context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. question: How does FDIC insurance apply to Openbank's UltraSecure high yield savings accounts opened on March 15, 2023?
answer: High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Power of attorney: Not offered but honored** Currently, Openbank high yield savings accounts do not offer the ability to add a Power of Attorney. That said, if an unexpected need arises, we can honor a power or attorney or court appointment on an emergent and one-time basis, to ensure that account funds are disbursed to a designated agent.

Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. question: Will I be able to add a new beneficiary if my current policy requires all beneficiaries to be authorized by the underwriter in the last quarter of 2023?
answer: Yes, you can add a new beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account by signing in to the Openbank app, selecting the account you want to update, clicking on My beneficiaries, and then selecting Add a new beneficiary and following the directions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. question: Is there a specific type of insurance provided by the FDIC for funds deposited in the Emerald Green Investment account with Openbank as of February 28, 2023?
answer: High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **About high yield savings account** High yield savings accounts are interest-bearing savings accounts that can offer higher interest rates than the national average of standard savings accounts. They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

question: Will Openbank allow me to transfer funds from my linked external account to another Openbank account without any limit if both accounts have a negative balance on September 30th of the previous year?
answer: Yes, you can transfer funds from your linked external account to another Openbank account. To do so, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device, visit the Transfer and Pay section, and navigate to the Manage and Activity tab. Select Manage my recipients, then follow the prompts to add the recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name and follow the directions to move money out to the other Openbank account.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust.

question: Will I get an extra confirmation if I update my address using a specific third-party app?
answer: No, you will not receive an extra confirmation when updating your address.
context: **Update address** To change your address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update address. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S. **Update email address** To change your email address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update email address. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.

question: How do I access my Openbank account from a desktop or laptop computer after setting up the Electrum Wallet on June 15, 2023?
answer: If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer.
context: **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: How do I enable the two-factor authentication for my Openbank account from a laptop running macOS Ventura version 13.5 using the Citadel Encryption Standard?

When you try to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we will automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity on your mobile device, you will be able to sign in on your computer.
context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. question: How do I remove a joint account owner from my Openbank account after they have been charged with identity theft and are no longer allowed to access the account according to company policy?
answer: To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: If I forgot my User ID, is there a limit of three attempts per day to regain access, or will I be locked out permanently?
answer: If you forgot your User ID, use the Forgot user ID link on the sign in screen and follow the directions.
context: **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. If you can't remember them, use the Forgot user ID or Forgot password links on the sign in screen, and then follow the directions. If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You cannot change your user ID. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet.

question: What is the process for closing a High-Yield Savings account with STU Bank, and what steps must be taken to ensure all funds are properly transferred to another account?
answer: To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
questions: What is the process for closing a High-Yield Savings account with STU Bank, and what steps must be taken to ensure all funds are properly transferred to another account?

question: The final status of my transaction remains hidden because it was flagged for review by an automated system named "SmartReview Pro v2.1," which is not listed in your official service directory.
answer: To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: In case of a dispute over transactions made by the person managing your Openbank account, what steps will be taken if they refuse to provide proof of each transaction's legitimacy?
answer:
If the person managing your Openbank account refuses to provide proof of each transaction's legitimacy during a dispute, we will take the following steps: 
1. We will contact the person managing your account to request proof of each transaction's legitimacy. 
2. If they still refuse to provide proof, we will place a hold on the disputed transactions until the issue is resolved. 
3. We will work with you to investigate the disputed transactions and determine their legitimacy. 
4. If the transactions are found to be fraudulent, we will take appropriate action to protect your account and funds. 
5. If the transactions are found to be legitimate, we will release the hold and provide you with an updated transaction history.

question: What are the specific conditions under which interest starts accruing for a "Pay-As-You-Go" savings plan that automatically adjusts APYs based on daily income, starting from the first business day after each paycheck is deposited between May and September 2022?
answer: You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

answer: Interest on deposited funds in a high-yield online savings account starts accumulating as soon as the deposit is received, regardless of the time of day or whether it is a business hour. The interest accrues daily and is paid monthly based on the account's statement cycle, which is determined by the account opening date. Therefore, even if the scheduled transfers occur during non-business hours from 9 PM to 7 AM daily in February 2023, the interest will begin to accumulate immediately upon receipt of the funds.

question: How can I withdraw my funds from my account to pay for a luxury yacht charter on June 15th next year?
answer: To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions.

answer: To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account.

Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. context: **Fraudulent activity** If you suspect unauthorized or fraudulent activity on your Openbank high yield savings account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it.

question: What are the necessary steps to enable Face ID for accessing my iCloud account, and is there a limit to how many faces can be registered in the system?
answer: To enable Face ID for accessing your iCloud account, go to the device settings on your Apple smartphone or tablet. Follow the prompts to add Face ID. We've created a step-by-step demo for Apple devices at openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup.
context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.
questions: What are the necessary steps to enable Face ID for accessing my iCloud account, and is there a limit to how many faces can be registered in the system?

question: How do I unlock my account if it was locked by the fraud detection system after detecting suspicious activity patterns on December 15th, 2023?
answer: To unlock your account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. If you can't remember them, use the Forgot user ID or Forgot password links on the sign in screen, and then follow the directions. If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You cannot change your user ID.

Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: How do I initiate the process of opening a high yield savings account with Openbank after submitting your tax ID number and confirming that all financial transactions will be subject to an annual audit conducted by an independent third-party auditor approved by both FinCEN and the SEC, ensuring compliance with BSA guidelines?
answer: Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: How does your savings account earn interest compared to a high-yield money market fund on average days in March 2023?
answer: Your high yield savings account earns interest by accruing daily and paying out monthly when your statement cycles.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **About high yield savings account** High yield savings accounts are interest-bearing savings accounts that can offer higher interest rates than the national average of standard savings accounts. They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

question: How do I withdraw my balance before closing my account if I have a pending transaction from "GreenLeaf Financial Services" that will affect my available funds on March 15th?
answer: To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.
context: **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: How do I withdraw funds from my account at "PrimeTrust Bank" before closing it on December 31st if there is an ongoing legal dispute that requires mediation by March 1st?
answer: To withdraw funds from your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: How do I change the name on my Openbank account if I moved to a new country in 2022?
answer: To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking.
context: **Update name** To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: Can I access my Openbank account details via the mobile app after logging out on October 1st, 2023?
answer: Yes, you can access your Openbank account details via the mobile app after logging out on October 1st, 2023.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Is it possible for me to receive interest payments on my high yield savings account in monthly installments starting December 1, 2027, at Openbank?
answer: Yes, you can receive interest payments on your high yield savings account in monthly installments. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your account monthly when your statement cycles, which is based on the date you opened your account.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: How often does the financial institution's algorithm determine when to add interest to my account based on historical spending patterns?
answer: Interest is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles, which is based on the date you opened your account.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: What steps should be taken if there are no beneficiaries listed in the Openbank app despite having active accounts associated with it?
answer: To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. question: Can I access my Openbank account balance and transactions from multiple devices simultaneously without any restrictions as of December 31st, 2022?
answer: Yes, you can access your Openbank account balance and transactions from multiple devices simultaneously without any restrictions.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Can I access my Openbank account balance and transactions from multiple devices simultaneously without any restrictions as of November 30th, 2022?
answer: Yes, you can access your Openbank account balance and transactions from multiple devices simultaneously without any restrictions.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. question: How can I view the transaction history for all deposits made into my savings account between October 2021 and March 2022?
answer: To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: What are the terms and conditions for opening a joint account at Openbank compared to those set forth by the GHI Bank as outlined in their FAQ section updated July 2021?
answer: To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust.

question: What is a trusted device and how do I set it up in the year 2022 during the global pandemic?
answer: A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: Could you guide me through accessing my statements via the Openbank app after I've logged into two separate accounts with different usernames and passwords that were created last year?
answer:
1. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. 
2. Select the account you want to view. 
3. Your transaction history will be displayed. 
4. To find your high yield savings account documents, click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo.

context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. As a digital bank, Openbank doesn't provide paper statements. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. question: How does having a trusted device protect your account from being compromised by attackers using sophisticated techniques such as zero-day exploits since June 1, 2023?
answer: A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.
