question: What steps should I follow to enable Openbank alerts for every instance of a failed transaction attempt flagged as "Card Declined" since February 2023?
answer: To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.
context: **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: Is it possible to convert my current savings account into a joint account with a partner named Alex Carter?
answer: To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email.
context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust.

question: How do I activate biometric authentication for notifications on my Openbank mobile app after upgrading the software version to v2.3.4 in September 2021 and linking it to a secondary phone number provided by SecureAuth Inc.?
answer: To activate biometric authentication for notifications on your Openbank mobile app, you need to enable notifications for the Openbank app in your device settings. Open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.
context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. answer: If an error occurs while adding a new recipient with a bank account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for assistance.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: I recently read on an online forum that once I deposit funds into my high-yield savings account, they are immediately available for use after the bank processes the transaction within their standard business day timeframe. Is this information accurate?
answer: Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
context: **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Is it possible to open a joint account with Openbank through their partnership with the International Joint Ownership Association starting July 15th, 2023?
answer: Yes, it is possible to open a joint high yield savings account with Openbank. To do so, you must first sign up for your own account. Once your account is open, you can add a new joint account owner by signing in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device, selecting your account, and then selecting Add an account owner. Follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once the process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email.
context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: Can I open an Openbank account with my Social Security number and a valid driver's license from any state in the US?
answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account at Openbank by visiting openbank.us or using the Openbank mobile banking app.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: How do I request a hard reset of my Openbank online banking password from a foreign country using only an email address?
answer: To reset your password, use the Forgot password link on the sign in screen and follow the directions.
context: **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. If you can't remember them, use the Forgot user ID or Forgot password links on the sign in screen, and then follow the directions. If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You cannot change your user ID. **Update name** To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. question: How do I check my Openbank account balance using the mobile app on my iPad Pro 12.9-inch, model A1978?
answer: To check your Openbank account balance using the mobile app on your iPad Pro 12.9-inch, model A1978, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Your account balance will be displayed on the main screen after logging in.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Can I view historical transaction data for my Openbank account from January 1, 2020, to December 31, 2022?
answer: Yes, you can view your transaction history for any date range within your account's history by signing in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and selecting the account you want to view.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: How do I update my personal information if I opened an OpenBank account through a financial advisor named "John Doe" on January 1, 2022?
answer: To update your personal information, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: When will I see interest added to my monthly investment portfolio statement for the holdings managed by J.P. Morgan Chase's New York office processed through their Miami server farm?
answer: Interest is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid.

question: Can I change the name associated with my OpenBank account to include a middle initial such as "J." after opening it on June 15, 2023, without affecting other accounts in my family?
answer: To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking.
context: **Update name** To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions.

question: When will I see interest earned on my money market fund with Citigroup added to my monthly banking statement processed through their New York headquarters?
answer: Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account at Openbank by visiting openbank.us and selecting Open savings account on the home page, or by using Openbank's mobile banking app available for free on the App Store or Google Play.

You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: Can you provide me with a step-by-step guide on enabling online access for my account using the new "Biometric Verification Interface" added in version 4.2 of our system?
answer: To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.
context: **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer.

question: Can you walk me through enabling online access for my account using the newly implemented "Two-Factor Authentication Protocol v2.1", which was released on January 10th, 2023?
answer: To enable online access for your account, you need to download the Openbank app and sign into your account. Once you're signed in, you'll be automatically prompted to set up your trusted mobile device, which is a quick and easy 2-minute process. This device is required for online access and helps ensure that only you can access and perform sensitive actions on your account.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.

They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

question: I need detailed instructions on how to enable online access for my account using the newly implemented "End-to-End Encryption Protocol v3.2", effective from November 15th, 2023.
answer: To enable online access for your account, you need to download the Openbank app and sign into your account. Once you are signed in, you will be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet as a trusted mobile device. This setup process is quick and easy, taking only about 2 minutes. After setting up your trusted mobile device, you will have online access to your account.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.

question: Is it true that customers can request a physical bank statement for their openbank account starting from Fridays, even though the service is usually available only on Tuesdays and Thursdays?
answer: No, Openbank does not provide paper statements as we are a 100% digital bank. You can access your account documents, including statements, through the Document Center in the Openbank app.
context: **Document Center: Statements, letters, notices, tax documents, account disclosures, public disclosures** To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Then select Document Center. You will then see options for Statements, Letters and Notices, Tax Documents, Account Disclosures, and Public Disclosures. As a digital bank, Openbank doesn't provide paper statements. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
